title: Amol Rajan Leaves a Popular Radio Show
summary: Amol Rajan is leaving his job as a presenter on BBC Radio 4's Today programme, which is a famous news show. He has worked there for almost five years. Rajan wants to start his own company in the digital world, which he calls the 'creator economy.' He will still do some work for the BBC, like hosting University Challenge, a quiz show, and his podcast called Radical. The BBC has rules that might not allow him to present news while running his own business. No one knows yet who will take his place on the Today show. Rajan says he is excited about his new adventure but will miss his team, whom he calls the best. He praises the BBC as a great cultural institution.

background_read: The BBC is a big broadcasting company in the UK that makes TV and radio shows. The Today programme is one of its most important news shows on Radio 4, where presenters talk about current events. Presenters like Amol Rajan help share news with listeners. Sometimes, people leave their jobs to try new things, like starting a business or working on different projects. Rajan is doing this to explore the digital world, where many people create content online to earn money. This is part of a trend called the 'creator economy,' which is growing popular.
